events.name: Paper Presentation
events.description: Showcase your research and innovative ideas through paper presentations.
events.longDescription: The Paper Presentation event is designed to encourage students to conduct research, analyze topics, and present their findings. Participants will have the opportunity to present their papers to a panel of judges and receive valuable feedback. Topics can range from emerging technologies to innovative solutions for real-world problems.
rules: Paper must be original and unpublished

events.name: POWERHOUSE
events.description: Unlock your potential in this electrifying three-round technical championship.
events.longDescription:
Test your electrical intuition through rapid-fire logic challenges designed to evaluate core conceptual strength

Round 1: Electrical Riddles
Round 2: Circuit Puzzle - Arrange the tiles to get the correct given circuit diagram
Round 3: Jumbled Electrical Words

events.name: PhotonQuest
events.description: PhotonQuest is a skill-oriented competitive challenge aimed at enhancing cognitive abilities.
events.longDescription: PhotonQuest is a skill-oriented competitive challenge aimed at enhancing cognitive abilities such as attention to detail, recall, and creative expression. Structured as a team centered competition, the event features a sequence of well designed rounds that require collaboration, analytical thinking, quick responses, and effective coordination. PhotonQuest offers an engaging platform for students to showcase their skills in an unconventional and enjoyable manner.
rules: Scores can be evaluated based on points
Eligible participants move to final round
Follow the instructions given by the organizer

events.name: Circuit Debugging
events.description: Debug faulty circuits and identify issues.
events.longDescription:
Test your circuit analysis skills by identifying errors in faulty circuits!
Round 1: Analyze circuit images and find the mistakes.
Round 2: Debug a virtual circuit using Tinkercad.

Think fast, debug smart, and prove your engineering skills.
üèÜ Exciting prizes await!
rules: Points based on correctness and time taken

events.name: MIND SPARK
events.description: A Technical Team Event ‚Äì EEE Department. MIND SPARK is a 3-round technical team event designed to ignite logical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving.
events.longDescription:
MIND SPARK is a 3-round technical team event designed to ignite logical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving through real-world Electrical & Electronics applications.
Open and engaging for students from all departments.

Rounds
1) Tech Tambola (EEE): Application-based concept recognition
2) Tech Pictionary & Connections: Draw, decode, and link EEE ideas
3) Basic Problem Solving: Simple, real-world EEE challenges
